99526.name: Disposable income inequality, Gini coefficient
99526.description: The gini coefficients for disposable income inequality are for 2004 for the US, 2005 for Sweden and 2006 for Japan. The US and Swedish ginis for disposable income inequality are from the Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Database the Japanese ginis for disposable income inequality are from the OECD.

source.name: Wang and Caminada (2011), OECD
source.dataPublishedBy: Chen Wang and Koen Caminada. 2011. ‘Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Dataset’. Version 1. Leiden Department of Economics Research; OECD Stat

99527.name: Earnings inequality (before taxes), Gini coefficient
99527.description: The gini coefficients for earnings inequality are for 2004 for the US, 2005 for Sweden and 2006 for Japan. The US and Swedish ginis for earnings inequality are from the Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Database, and the Japanese ginis for earnings inequality are from the OECD.

source.name: Wang and Caminada (2011), OECD
source.dataPublishedBy: Chen Wang and Koen Caminada. 2011. ‘Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Dataset’. Version 1. Leiden Department of Economics Research; OECD Stat

99528.name: Wealth inequality, Gini coefficient
99528.description: The gini coefficients for wealth inequality are for 2000 for the US and Sweden and 2003 for Japan.

source.name: Fochesato and Bowles (2013 and 2017)
source.dataPublishedBy: Mattia Fochesato and Samuel Bowles. 2013. ‘Wealth Inequality from Prehistory to the Present: Data, Sources and Methods.’ Dynamics of Wealth Inequality Project, Behavioral Sciences Program, Santa Fe Institute; Mattia Fochesato and Samuel Bowles. 2017. ‘Technology, Institutions and Wealth Inequality in the Very Long Run’. Santa Fe Institute
